title: Making a Simple Appointment by Phone

content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to make a simple appointment over the phone in German. This is a very common task!

data.meaning: I would like to make an appointment

data.tip: The 'ch' sound is soft, made in the front of your mouth, like the 'h' in 'huge'.

content.title: Stating Your Purpose
content.setting: You are calling a hairdresser's salon to make an appointment.

conversation_flow.title: Greet the receptionist and state your name

extract_info.user_name: Extract the user's name from their message

conversation_flow.title: Say you would like to make an appointment for a haircut
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Guten Tag, {user_name}. Was kann ich für Sie tun?

conversation_flow.title: Understand the question about when you want to come

content.text: Great start! Now let's learn how to talk about days and times. In German, you say 'am' before a day or a part of the day, like 'am Freitag' (on Friday).

content.title: Negotiating a Time
content.setting: You are continuing the phone call with the hairdresser.

conversation_flow.title: State your preference for a day (Friday)
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Okay. An welchem Tag passt es Ihnen?

conversation_flow.title: State your preference for a time of day (in the afternoon)
Decline the proposed time and ask if another time is possible
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Okay. Ich habe einen Termin um 14 Uhr.

content.text: Excellent! You're almost there. Let's learn the final phrases to confirm your appointment and end the call politely.
To say a time, you use 'um', for example: 'um 16 Uhr' (at 4 o'clock / 4 PM).

content.title: Confirmation
content.setting: You are finishing the phone call with the hairdresser.

conversation_flow.title: Agree on the new time offered
Repeat the day and time to confirm
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Super. Ihr Termin ist am Freitag um 16 Uhr.

conversation_flow.title: Thank the receptionist and end the call
